lead_paragraph: The American rookie John Isner waited out nine hours of rain, then beat Benjamin Becker, 6-3, 6-4, in 57 minutes last night in the first round of the Pilot Pen in New Haven. James Blake also won in straight sets, 6-4, 6-2, over Arnaud Clément. There were nine service breaks in the match, six by Blake, who broke Clément in the final game of each set. Clément was visibly upset by shouts from the pro-Blake crowd, many coming as he was about to serve. Blake grew up in Connecticut.
